intro: Rondeletia salicifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that resemble willow leaves, hence its common name. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Rondeletia salicifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
